Reviews.Title: Small wonder
Reviews.Author: I. Peters
Reviews.Content: The Lumix DMC-FH20V is my 5th digital point & shoot but my first Panasonic. I really like it for what it packs in its incredibly small and thin body. Of course it isn't perfect but no camera ever is. After playing with it for a while, here are my thoughts:The Color:I was a bit apprehensive before ordering the camera in the violet but really like it. Truth be told, I was a bit tired of the endless parade of silver-tone cameras and ready for something new. This purple color is not a candy-color purple but instead looks quite classy and nicely muted, especially with the brushed-metal surface.Pros:- Size & weight. The FH20 is perfect for anyone whose priority is to go light. I still cannot believe how they packed that many features into such a small and light-weight body (sorry for repeating myself).- The price. For roughly $170, this is a very good deal and the price contributed to my decision to buy this camera. When looking at other brands and models, most that had comparable mega pixels and zoom cost quite a bit more.- The combo of 14 mega pixels and an 8x optical zoom is great and was another deciding factor for me. I plan on taking this camera with me on an up-coming vacation,and felt that this allows for the versatility I will likely need and want when shooting all kinds of scenes. Beats shlepping my heavy and bulky Canon Powershot SX10IS  with me...- The auto-focus is fast and accurate. It locks reliably even in low-light conditions, much better than any of my previous cameras, including the aforementioned Canon SX10IS. One of my favorite features when it comes to this camera!- Easy to operate. I really did not need to consult the manual, which by the way comes in its entirety only in PDF-format on CD. The hard-copy manual included in the box only discusses the basic functions. But like I said, operating the camera is pretty straight-forward and logical. At first I had been a bit concerned with the tiny camera size and consequently small buttons but it works very well, and I do NOT have particularly small hands :-).- Tons of scene modes available for almost any situation imaginable. There are even two different portrait and scenery (i.e. landscape) modes - one regular and one for night!Cons (if one wants to call it that):- No manual control of aperture and shutter speed. I personally do not think of this as a negative simply because this camera is not geared to that type of photographer, but I know that some people like to have that option so I am including this in my list because of that only.- I found that image noise is very dependent on the zoom setting, even at lower ISO settings such as ISO80 or ISO100. While the camera shoots spectacularly well at short focal lengths and low ISO settings, it does not so well at long focal lengths (engaging the digital zoom). This is not too much of an issue when printing regular 4 x 6 or 5 x 7 prints but enlarging an image that was taken at full zoom might be problematic. Of course this is more or less the same for any camera but I still feel (admittedly subjectively) that the FH20 does not do the greatest job here and is on the same noise level (if not more) as my 4 yr-old Canon PowerShot A700 6MP Digital Camera with 6x Optical Zoom. That was slightly disappointing to me.- White Balance is also something that I was not entirely happy with. Pictures taken indoors often have a very yellow tint which looks unnatural. But the white balance settings can be changed and also allow for manual adjustment, so this is not too big of an issue.Summary:All in all I am quite happy with this camera. I researched a lot before I bought it and still think that the combo of price, size & weight and features is hard to beat. With every camera there will be something that one person loves and another does not care for much, it is an oftentimes subjective trade-off. But anyone looking for a great, lightweight and feature-rich camera likely won't be disappointed as long as he/she keeps in mind that this is a true point & shoot camera for people who want to take good pictures without having to take a photography class first.Last but not Least:When looking for a camera case for the FH20, I compared a lot of measurements for different cases to make sure it would fit the FH20. I finally settled on the Caselogic TBC-302 Ultra Compact Camera Case with Storage (Magenta). It fits and does the job without adding too much bulk, plus it accommodates a spare battery. Just thought I'd add that in case you don't want to look around too much for a suitable case...

Reviews.Title: Happy
Reviews.Author: Bec
Reviews.Content: After my Canon SD1100 broke in March, I researched for several weeks for a new camera. I went to several stores to feel and play with the newer Canon...but was incredibly disappointed to see the lack of features offered for the prices.Before the Canon, I owned a LumixFX07 which I was very pleased with, so I decided to look again to Panasonic.After looking at the features...and the lens size of the FH20 I decided to take a risk and buy it without ever seeing it in person (a first for me).I have owned this camera for about 2 months now and have used it quite often. (I am the girl in the group who always documents the events).Overall I am very pleased with the photo qualities and features. The only thing I find a little inconvenient is the white balance. I often have to play around with the different WB settings in order to get the color to look natural and not orange.Other than that I enjoy the ease of turning on the macro setting and the wide angle lens. Although it is light, it also feels sturdy and at first I was weary of the purple color, but it is not too flashy or obnoxious.I am just a hobby photographer and own a Nikon D50, but always have a pocket camera on me...and so far the FH20 has performed very well.

Reviews.Title: Awesome little camera!
Reviews.Author: Sean Mcgirk
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my wife to replace an older Canon she has been using for years. This is my first digital camera that is not a Canon and I have to say Panasonic has done a great job. Very good feature set. Shutter lag is nearly non existent which my wife loves. She can now get pictures of our kids with them in the frame! This camera is a really small, tight and high quality package. The zoom is awesome and the 720p video, while you are unable to use the zoom while filming, is a really nice that you have to pay another hundred dollars for with other brands. The ability to focus correctly and quickly in all situations, the detail and the color reproduction is nothing short of flawless so far. We still need to do some experimenting with low light pictures but I think those come out pretty good too. The flash does not extend too far but is effective at short range and takes some good night pictures as long as you stay within that range. I would definately reccomend this camera to anyone looking for a compact point and shoot.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of comparing between this camera and the Sony Cybershot series.  Ended up with the Panasonic because of the larger optical zoom and I'm really pleased with my decision.  It takes great photos.  The colors are bright and true, it does really well in low light situations, and the Intelligent Auto setting is fantastic.  It's small and lightweight, but still feels substantial in your hand.  The screen is large and bright and the controls are easy to master.  Two reasons why I didn't give it a perfect score-- 1) The menus are a little hard to navigate.  It's fine once you get used to it, but there can be a lot of button-pressing to get to what you want.  Fortunately, the Intelligent Auto setting takes care of most of this, so it's not a huge problem.  2) The software that comes with the camera is not Mac compatible and the camera itself has a hard time with iPhoto.  I'm pretty sure iPhoto '09 took care of this problem, but for those of us who don't want to spend the money on that it kind of stinks.  To get pictures on my computer, I have to use Image Capture and then move them into iPhoto manually.  Not a big deal, but it would have been nice to know before purchasing the camera.  But all in all, I am really pleased with the photos this camera takes and the HD video is nice too!!  I highly recommend this one!

Reviews.Title: Worth Its Cost
Reviews.Author: K. Trier
Reviews.Content: Its size makes it perfect to take along on my motorcycle.14 M setting is great for printing and a print I did isthe only way I could prove its quality since I'd need avery high resolution monitor and graphics card to proveit on a computer.It's a really decent little camera. Very worth its cost.It has a 10.5 M 16 x 9 setting I really like 'causepictures taken can be displayed on my HD monitorfrom the get go without altering them.Since I have a 1920 x 1080 HD camcorder I'm not concernedwith the camera movie mode but to anyone reading this Iwould say it takes decent movies but no zooming once youstart. So preset zoom before you begin.Also, small cameras like this have crappy audio.Camera records to .mov format so you may needprogram to edit your stuff.The still pictures are what is good about this cameraand I'm quite happy with it

Reviews.Title: Great 2nd camera...
Reviews.Author: Shae Ali
Reviews.Content: This camera is awesome! I own a Canon Rebel, but decided to buy a 2nd camera to use on vacations and for quick snapshots of my son around the house. It is, by far, the coolest camera I've used...and I've used a lot (and returned a lot). The clarity on the pictures - when developed - is amazing. The 8x optical zoom on this and the 14.1 MP is what makes it a great camera. The options are endless with this camera. I would definitely suggest this camera over any other if you're looking for a light, compact, and stylish camera that can get the job done whether you're at home or on vacation.Just one word of advice:DON'T LOSE IT! *lol*

Reviews.Title: Keeping it, but not entirely confident in it
Reviews.Author: PandaMom
Reviews.Content: When I ordered this camera I was certain it was "the one". My mom has a Lumix and we've been very happy with it. But then I received it, and it has one HUGE bad point - the white balance is AWFUL for fluorescent/CFL lighting. However it took me so long to do testing on it, compare photos to other cameras, etc, that I waited too long and can't return it now. So I am keeping it and I will make do, but I am stressed and unhappy by the flaw. We've had three Casio Exilims and the other Lumix and never noticed this issue with them.I use a lot of CFL bulbs in my home, and at school and other commercial buildings it's mostly fluorescent lighting. Most of the photos I take at home or at school or church are VERY YELLOW with this camera. I tried every white balance setting, but there doesn't seem to be one specifically for fluorescent, so I can't find anything that fixes this problem.In terms of anything bad to say, that white balance flaw is really it. Otherwise, this camera is fine. It's a nice size, not too small. Outdoor pictures are great. With the class 10 SD card, it writes even 14MP photos quickly. It has a lot of Scene modes. The Baby 1 and Baby 2 scene modes allow you to set a birthday for your child and then when you take photos it tells you exactly how old they were in the photo.As a general complaint about all cameras, I cant see any reason to shoot a 14MP photo. I wish you could still get a 8MP camera that was super good quality, rather than these extreme MP cameras that seem like the quality is just so-so at all levels, rather than really good across the board. With this Lumix, the quality is fine for what I shoot (mostly pics of the kids and outings we take, nothing professional), but I wouldnt say it's the best thing ever.So that is all I have to say at the moment. This isn't a bad camera. But am I unhappy with it.

Reviews.Title: I love it!
Reviews.Author: S. Espinosa "mewant1ofeach"
Reviews.Content: ok let's keep this short and sweet: I've been using my camera for a tad over a month now. What I like most about the camera is the features, ease of use, and the overall picture quality.What I dislike about the camera is that the auto white balance doesn't always work right. You have to play around with it but it's not a big deal for me. It takes awesome pictures with the macro feature, and even without it, they still capture a lot of detail. Really love the camera and would purchase it all over again.

Reviews.Title: A lot of camera for a point and click!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "StayC"
Reviews.Content: So far I am amazed at what this camera can do. It's just a little point and click...a PURPLE point and click I might add...but it has a lot of amazing qualities. I love all the settings, the large LCD (larger than my last camera) I adore the Burst and high-speed Burst options. That's actually why I bought the camera, it works amazing for kids and animals! I haven't had the camera more than a few weeks, and I probably still don't know half of what it can do, but what I have figured out and done with it so far, I love it.It's easy, lots of features, burst option, macro...really takes some great pictures, and did I say it's PURPLE!I'm not a camera guru, so having this be easy to use and take great pictures was a must, and it is!

Reviews.Title: amazing little camera
Reviews.Author: C. Mei Fung
Reviews.Content: this little camera worked great. Its stabilizing feature was amazing, I could even walk and take pictures with it without flash, and the photos still came out focused and clear.

Reviews.Title: awesome  awesome  awesome
Reviews.Author: Craig01020 "just me"
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 10-day vacation. Shot over 800 photos with this camera. Excellent zoom and wide angle, yet slim enough to keep in my front pants pocket. I liked this camera so much that as soon as I got home I bought a second one for my wife.

Reviews.Title: Lumix camera
Reviews.Author: Buzz
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to replace one I have had for 5 years.  The improvements in design and ease of use have come a long way.  This camera is light, compact, and easy to use right out of the box.  I have already taken some great pictures with it and will enjoy having this camera with me always ready to capture some memories.  I even got a nice color my wife loves.  I am still learning to use some of the great features and my pictures will only get better.  I love the photo shop program that comes with the package.  I am new to the things you can do after the pictures are loaded in to my computer.  I now can forward pictures through emails thanks to this program.  I would highly recomend this camera for its features, compact size and the great pictures it can take.  Dont forget the price was right.

Reviews.Title: Good camera, bad customer service
Reviews.Author: GPaw Flyer "J Park3"
Reviews.Content: Pros: The size of the camera and the picture quality were very good. The 8x zoom was impressive for the quality.Cons: The worst customer service I have ever experienced. I have had various electronic devices that develop problems and have always had good service for repairs under warranty.  Until this Panasonic product.  I will never buy another Panasonic camera nor would I recommend it to anyone else due to their disqualifying nature toward repairs.Summary: I researched this size and style of camera and found favorable reviews online. After 6 months of routine use the display wouldn't operate as the viewfinder or mode display. I reviewed the warranty, 1 year, and found the return information.  I mailed it to their repair center in McAllen, TX, indicating what the defect was.  I received a letter in about 2 weeks indicating "we have found your unit is not covered by warranty" claiming it was dented on a corner.  I had not dropped the camera nor was there any dented corner.  I could pay $136.40 to receive a refurbed camera with a 90 day warranty when I originally spent $156.00 for the new one.  Don't even ask me what I would think of their 90 warranty. Why not just state sold as is?  I will have to pay for a NEW camera, but it won't be a Panasonic.  My old Kodak may have been short on zoom, but they were LONG on customer service. Don't waste your money on this gamble; the deck is stacked in Panasonic's favor.

Reviews.Title: THE best camera for the money
Reviews.Author: Brian C.
Reviews.Content: I am a professional cinematographer so I am used to working with pro video cameras and DSLRs all the time. When my girlfriend asked for a camera for christmas I couldn't just buy something without spending a lot of time researching online and trying out cameras in the stores. I have to say that I would buy one of these for myself as a day-to-day point & shoot.Pros:High qualityWide variety of scene modesWide angle lensStrong aluminum constructionEasy to use menus & buttonsCons:f3.3-5 lens apertureShutter style lens cover

Reviews.Title: Dark pictures
Reviews.Author: Wendy Siska
Reviews.Content: I really was looking forward to this camera as I needed something with more speed to take pictures of my fast moving daughter.  The pictures in the Baby mode come out pretty well, only a few have been out of focus but they are really dark!  I have to fix the pictures on my computer with photo software so they are not so discolored.  The walls in my house are a light brown and when I take pictures indoors, the pictures come out so brown. I can't use the portrait mode as it takes forever to start capturing the picture.  I have only had this camera for about 5 months and I am getting rid of it and buying a Nikon instead. Very disappointing!

Reviews.Title: Excellent little camera
Reviews.Author: MMcDonald
Reviews.Content: We bought the Panasonic DMC-Fh20 to have a lightweight digital camera to carry on a trip. It is compact and takes great pictures. Very pleased with this purchase and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Love my Lumix!
Reviews.Author: Ian Rasmussen
Reviews.Content: We wanted a compact digital camera with a good zoom, image stability and priced under $200 - the Lumix fits the bill perfectly.  It takes decent video also.

Reviews.Title: its pretty
Reviews.Author: Marianne
Reviews.Content: I chose this camera mostly because of the minimal shutter lag.  I have cats so it was an important feature.  I had really high expectations but sadly, cats still have time to move. This is my first digital camera and so far am quite pleased.  It came with all the cables, recharger and battery so I think that was a good deal.  The menu is easy to navigate for a novice like me.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix
Reviews.Author: tefsearch
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for a short period of time, but so far, I am impressed. It has a higher mp and better zoom than most cameras of this type. It is still small and compact, has a large viewing screen and the features are so easy to use. Also, the photos I've printed have been beautiful.

Reviews.Title: great little camera
Reviews.Author: Jann
Reviews.Content: Love this little camera.  Wasn't sure I would like it because it doesn't have a viewfinder but I am learning to love it.  I even took some hand-held pictures of fireworks and I was very pleased with the results.  I would highly recommend it especially to keep in your pocket at all times for that one miracle shot you might just get.

Reviews.Title: I am in LOVE with this camer!!!
Reviews.Author: Bookworm
Reviews.Content: I absolutely LOVE this camera! The intelligent auto feature is amazing and takes great pictures. This camera takes quality pictures in a variety of lighting situations. The color of this camera is beautiful and as a person who loves purple I really like it. It's easy to operate. I like how compact the camera is and that it can fit in my pocket when I go out. The slideshow settings is very nice and it's very cool that you can plug it into the tv and watch your pictures in a slideshow with the music you set. The zoom on the camera is very good. The rechargeable battery stays charged and is easy to charge. All in all this camera is great and has an unbelieveable price. I would recommed this camera and already one of my friends is contemplating buying it.

Reviews.Title: Why Did I Wait So Long??
Reviews.Author: Coffee Please
Reviews.Content: I have been reviewing camera's for 6 months trying to make the right decision for a small, lightweight camera.  I think I wore myself out trying to make a decision.  But I finally decided on the Panasonic Lumix DMC-FH20 14.1 MP digital camera with 8x optical image stabilized zoom.  The camera is awesome.  I have just started using it and it is very easy to just pick up and shoot pictures.  We took family pictures this weekend and I swear they turned out portrait quality.  I am so pleased!!!  And, not that it's a big deal, the purple color is awesome. And to top it all off it was very affordably priced.  Happy.  Happy.  Happy!!!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Vagabond
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. I have always been a Canon or Nikon girl, and never considered a Panasonic for some reason. When my well-used Canon gave up the ghost after several years, I bought a Nikon Coolpix. It died completely after 8 months after actually having very little use. Fortunately it was still under warranty, but I wasn't going to try that again. A friend loved her Lumix, so when I found a great price on Amazon, decided to give it a try.There isn't anything I don't like about it. The controls are very easy to use, it has some great features that are easy to access. I was really surprised when I connected it to my TV for a slideshow and there was animation and music - impressed not only me, but my entire family.The resolution is great, photos are beautiful and videos are perfect. I've just created a framed collage for a friend and the images are outstanding.I wasn't sure about the color when I ordered it, but it's beautiful - not garish - just a nice muted violet.  I highly recommend the camera.

Reviews.Title: Prodigious camera
Reviews.Author: Irina
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera. At first I have purchaced this camera for me and my friends like it very much. They desided to acquire panasonic lumix dmc-fh20 too. I am very satisfied with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great point and shoot camera
Reviews.Author: Roxanne Savage "Will"
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a small point and shoot camera, this is an excellent choice.  Great clear pics.  I don't bother with manual settings, but it has them all.  I usually use regular auto and sometimes use manual flash.  I've used the Intelligent Auto for some difficult shots (up-close night shots of people with illuminated objects in the background) and it worked well.  I bought the previous version a year ago and it still works perfectly.  I had been looking for a purple camera for my wife, and when this new model was released in purple, I bought it.  My wife never changes any settings and typical 'party' pics are very good.

Reviews.Title: Good camera!
Reviews.Author: Michelle "Go 'Dores!"
Reviews.Content: I was torn between this camera and the Canon SD1400IS. I'm not a big photography buff, but I did a bunch of research to pick a camera. I went with this one because of the powerful 8x optical zoom. I'm in my early 20s, so most of my pictures are taken by other people of groups of my friends and me at dinner, etc. People tend to really push the zoom on cameras, and with my old camera, I got very noisy images. It hasn't been a problem at all with this one! The only thing about this camera is that it's a bit bigger than the SD1400IS (which is pocket-sized); however, I've been pleased with my decision to trade size for quality.

Reviews.Title: Replacement battery that does not work with this camera ...
Reviews.Author: JimC
Reviews.Content: I purchased a new Panasonic Lumix DMC FH20 14.1 MP Digital camera with 8X optical zoom.  When I purchased it on line, it listed a series of items that others purchased when they bought this camera.  I thought the replacement battery purchased would work in this camera.  The Maximal Power DB DMW-BCF10 Replacement Battery was one of the items. It even looks like the more expensive Panasonic genuine replacement battery, yet at a significantly reduced cost.The practice of listing other items in this case is deceptive in that others that purchased it also found out that it does not work in this camera!  I do not recommend that you purchase this replacement battery for this particular camera.  It appears that you will have to go to Panasonic and get the battery for the additional cost to ensure you have the right one.  I wish I had done that from the beginning.

Reviews.Title: Great bang for the buck
Reviews.Author: S. Mcquillan "srimster"
Reviews.Content: This camera has so many features and is amazing.  I had an older model of a Panasonic that I accidentally dropped from about 10 feet high and shattered so I needed to replace it.  Everyone told me to buy a Canon so I did. Boy was I disappointed. I returned the Canon 940IS and bought this camera.  The Panasonic cameras have very powerful flashes that go about 10+ feet.  Canon flashes go about 6 at the max so all the indoor photos were junk.  This camera has a great zoom that is so useful for sports etc..  I actually read the user manual and have done a few great portraits as well.  You won't be disappointed. Go to [...] if you want more specifics on what this camera has to offer.

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: James P. Becker
Reviews.Content: The camera was a good quality item and I love that it is very thin to just put in my purse.

Reviews.Title: Excellent value
Reviews.Author: Isabelle Herbert "Essex Girl"
Reviews.Content: While this is not the greatest camera ever made, it is excellent value for money and very easy to use.  It is also better than the Nikon Coolpix I used to own, whose loss made me buy this.

Reviews.Title: nice and functional!!
Reviews.Author: aped
Reviews.Content: have been very happy thus far with my purchase, good quality pics...nice speed for taking pics, and small compact size with durability (it's been knocking around in my gigantic purse unscathed save for a couple scratches!!) all in all a good buy for those who want an economical, functional little camera!!

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: Melanie
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my mom a month ago because I didn't want to share a camera with her anymore. She loves it. It takes clear photos, and everything is easy to understand. Great focus, flash, zoom etc....and very compact, but a little heavier than my Kodak m580. But I definitely would recommend this to others.

Reviews.Title: nice little camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my daughter. Great picture quality. Seems well built. She loves the color. Good Macros.

Reviews.Title: awesome camera
Reviews.Author: christinefairbanks
Reviews.Content: This camera is awesome. It's size is perfect for dinner dates, clubs, anywhere really.  The zoom feature is the best-8x! I love this now I don't have to get up close to get the perfect shot.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Suzanne "italiano"
Reviews.Content: I needed an easy camera with high clarity of pictures for my Europe vacation. It satisfied all my wants and needs for picture taking. I love this camera and would recommend it. I would even consider buying a higher technical version of this camera. The only drawback, which seems to be in all p&s; cameras, is that when taking video the zoom selection you start with is what you stay with for that segment of video. LOVE this camera.

Reviews.Title: Very happy
Reviews.Author: alf
Reviews.Content: had another Panasonic lumix but dropped and broke it. Must not be making any more since I could not find anywhere. I really loved the pix I took with that camera.Although the present camera was half the price of the old camera I have been pleased with the pix. Nice clear shots. It is easy to use, lightweight and will be great for travel.

Reviews.Title: Back to Canon i go!...
Reviews.Author: NTucker "NTucker"
Reviews.Content: On my birthday, my bottle  of hand sanitizer opened in my purse and masacred my Canon powershot. I was crushed.So, I went on a quest to find my next trusty pocketpoint- and- shoot companion.I did tons of research and read reviews on picture quality, price, video, lag time, etc., on many brands. After much deliberation, and without actually seeing it in person, I decided to trust the many who like this camera. I took the plunge and bought it from Amazon.Ever since, I have secretly hoped to accidentally break or lose it, so I have a good excuse to buy a different camera.Background: I'm a mother of a highly energetic and often unruly toddler, an artist, a novice designer and blogger, and a picture- taking fanatic. I used to use my Canon on a daily basis. Now, I barely take photos because I seriously loathe this thing...I feel like it wastes my time, composition and creativity. Let's just say that camera and I aren't on the same team.Here's why: The lag time leaves me standing pictureless, in the dust of my child; the photo quality (color, focus, crispness) doesn't hold a candle to that of my old Canon-- I frequently find myself trying to digitally doctor my photos to compensate for the poor quality-- the things that wouldn't have been an issue with my previous camera. As others have mentioned, the white balance requires way too much effort and adjustment to make it correct; and I hate the fact that I can't zoom in or lock-in and focus on my subject when I'm shooting a video.Lumix, I opened my heart to you and trusted you... (especially because you were purple and pretty)... unfortunately, you were a complete and utter dissapointment. A waste of my money and time.Now, back to my true love, Canon, I go...

Reviews.Title: Spend More For Better Pictures
Reviews.Author: jsb
Reviews.Content: I'm an MFA Studio Arts Major and Photography is my main medium. I bought this to be a backup when out with my baby instead of dragging my big SLR. The shutter on this camera lags that you can't catch the moment too well plus there's a major color cast with this camera even in sunny outdoor conditions. I would say the higher Lumix are well worth paying more for (i.e., DMC-ZS series). I also like the Canon point and shoots a lot better. Better color, faster shutter.

Reviews.Title: dont buy this camera
Reviews.Author: mary
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera mainly because of the color. Mistake. The camera does not auto focus half the time and will not shut off when you turn it off, I have to open the bottom and remove the battery to shut it off.  There is no way to hold the camera and take a photo without hitting all the buttons on the back and messing up everything. I returned the camera and ordered a canon camera.  Also , the picture quality was terrible, the pictures came out with a yellow tint and were not clear despite the fact that it was a 14mp camera.

Reviews.Title: good pix but unusual problem
Reviews.Author: T. Deane "musician-songwriter"
Reviews.Content: after a year it developed a small brown spot on the interior of the lens that shows up in telephoto shots. Estimate to fix it were almost as much as the camera itself cost. We still use it but have to be selective about shots if we don't want the spot to show up

Reviews.Title: Buy something else
Reviews.Author: Afld Manager "Air Force"
Reviews.Content: Terrible! Don't waste your money on this product. I bought this for my wife and it was broken within a week.

Reviews.Title: Just what you expect
Reviews.Author: Beth
Reviews.Content: Great Camera. I have had this camera for about 5 years and it is still going strong. Takes great pictures and I couldn't be happier with the purple color as well! And I am a bargain shopper, so the price was fantastic as well. Great for everyday picture taking!

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Trish Hebert
Reviews.Content: I love this camera! It's small enough to put in your pocket or tuck it away in your purse. It takes clear/beautiful quality pictures and video. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Great for point and shoot
Reviews.Author: A. Lau
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my fiance a couple years ago as a gift as she was using a big bulky Canon that still used 4 AA batteries.  So to save her money on batteries and to make her purse lighter I bought her this camera.She loved it.  She took it with us everywhere for pictures of the food we ate mostly and on trips lol.  She has the trigger finger between us.Decent quality for a point and shoot digital camera at the time of purchase.Cut a screen guard to protect the screen as she just throws it in her purse and it was a good thing I did as that guard has a ton of scratches on it.Don't lose the charger for the battery, it's very expensive to replace if you want a original charger, between $40-$80.  I bought a universal charger though as a replacement for $3 and it works so no big thing for us, though it didn't work overseas in Japan unfortunately.

Reviews.Title: Couldn't be simpler to take superior photos
Reviews.Author: Middle Eddie
Reviews.Content: Great pictures, no experience required! This is a quality camera for the money. Never disappoints. Set it for auto, snap the picture, be amazed.

Reviews.Title: great little cam
Reviews.Author: Zahra
Reviews.Content: This was for my mom, and she loves it, its good with movement and dark, takes great pics, compact.. wonderful for the price..

Reviews.Title: Photo Color Is Way Off
Reviews.Author: L. Klepzig
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for a couple years now so it has had a lot of use around the house, outside, and on several trips.  What I have never liked from the beginning and still don't is the color balance.  Photos with this camera always came out on the orange side.  I tried every flash and non-flash combination I could think of, and even played with all the manual settings like ISO's etc.  Finally by setting it to "cool" it got rid of the orangy color, but now photos are often too far on the blue scale unless the lighting is just perfect.Other than that, I've had zero issues with it, it is easy to use, and the battery life is quite good.  But I've had both Sony and Canon point-and-shoots previously and liked them both better, but this one had several good reviews so I decided to give it a try.

Reviews.Title: the camera we dreamed of in the 70's
Reviews.Author: Lawrence C. Neilson "times consumer"
Reviews.Content: While I did freelance work in the film era, I hadn't shot a frame for many years.  I wanted a digital camera to photograph my Leicas for eBay.  As I compared features, I decided against a bare-bones point-and-shoot.  This camera was well reviewed on photo sites, and had an array of basic features.I used it for over a year, mostly for nature studies in my yard, and local parks.  The image stabilization was amazing, producing decent shots in difficult lighting. These images were sometimes enlarged to 11" x 14", with little loss of apparent sharpness.  The flash was virtually never harsh.  Battery changing was easy, but a spare is mandatory if you plan extended shooting sessions.Now using a bridge camera, I see the Panasonic's strengths and weaknesses more clearly.  The lack of manual focus option makes some macro situations frustrating.  The resolution isn't comparable to that of the Nikon p7100.  The inability to use off-camera flash was an issue.On the positive side, the Panasonic, after having used the Nikon for a year, seems weightless.  Its closeup capabilities are considerable, and having the flash close to the axis of the lens makes certain shots easier to light evenly.  It fits in ANY pocket, not just a cargo pocket.In summary, this is an excellent choice for those who want point-and-shoot PLUS.  In other words, it will handle a number of macro and normal range situations better than most in its price range.  You don't need this much flexibility for snapshots, but its creative horizon is considerable.ps.  still haven't shot the Leicas;  having too much fun.

Reviews.Title: Good Point and Shoot Camera
Reviews.Author: K.Dub
Reviews.Content: I enjoy this little camera. It fits in my purse and I can take it everywhere with me. The only two things I would change if I were Panasonic is to offer more manual functions (I prefer taking manual photos) and the battery door needs to be better secured. I've had a few times where the camera just catches on the pouch zipper or my nail accidentally and swings wide open.

Reviews.Title: Good enough for starters!
Reviews.Author: Ally M.
Reviews.Content: Coming from someone who's only had 1 other digital camera that made the good qualities of the Panasonic Lumix DMC-FH20 in Violet more superior,I bought this camera because it was:-affordable (only $150!)-pretty violet!-compact/lightweight-easy-to-useMy impression of it is that it's a good enough starter camera for those who just wants a point-and-shoot with a little extra on the side. You can play with the different options of changing your pictures to other colors and to certain moods or themes.The picture quality? Not as clear and sharp as I'd want it to be - but it works fairly well.The lag time? Of course there's a slight issue - but it's not *that* slow like older cameras.The look? It's *really* pretty. The color and style makes it look like it's not cheap at all.The feel? When I hold it, it's not as steady and balanced as I'd want it to be. It almost feels like it could slip out of your fingers, so hold on to it tightly!The buttons - I have an issue with this because they're so tiny!The use? Like I said, it's that easy that I didn't need to read a manual or have a hard time trying to figure out what each button did. I like the different options, so that's a plus there.The intelligence auto (IA) is a big help for those who wants an automatic point-and-shoot.Other than that, you can change the settings to your liking, but you have to remember to change it again next time! That makes all the hassle more fun. If you're lazy, just use IA!Overall, I like how easy it is to use, the LOOK, and the compact size.The price and look of the camera with the options to play with makes this camera worthy of those who wants an affordable, yet trendy-looking, and fun to play with camera. Thumbs up!Also, a note on the video part of the camera.Really, it's not for regular video recording. I think it's better to use it as a vlogging camera or a steady watch camera. You cannot ZOOM in or out! I tend to move the camera a lot instead of putting it in place. It looks very pixelly and only looks better if taken in HD.For me, it's also hard to tell when I'm recording a video, if it's recording or not. I always have to second guess whether if I have it on recording mode or not. So that's a sore thumb down on that part. Otherwise, just use it to vlog. It's very basic - for basic needs! :)For the price and effectiveness, I recommend this camera for those who just want something that works and is in their price range. Have fun this Panasonic Lumix camera! Good luck!-Satisfied and still having fun with this little gem.

Reviews.Title: Excelente!!
Reviews.Author: R. M "Reyna"
Reviews.Content: Cámara espectacular, se condiciona para cada ocasión, tanto de día como de noche, la pila dura para hasta 500 fotos o más. La recomiendo amplia mente para familias.

Reviews.Title: Great value of a compact camera
Reviews.Author: Convergent
Reviews.Content: I am a pro photographer and have been using Canon gear for years.  All my kids got Canon compact cameras, as well as my wife.  My daughter got one for Christmas, and it unfortunately got lost.  She is very into colors, and so we started looking at other brands and found this one.  I decided to take a chance with something non-Canon and got this camera for her to replace the one that was lost.  We are very happy with it.  Picture quality is great and the feature set is great... and she likes the color!  She's 15 and it works great for her.

Reviews.Title: I can finally take my camera with me everywhere!
Reviews.Author: Barbie "Hegnela"
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with this nifty little camera. I used to have one of the older, bulky model that was actually a lot more expensive. It turns out I couldn't really take it many places because it wouldn't fit in my purse, or would take up a lot of space in my luggage, etc. Plus, it used the rechargeable batteries that would run out after maybe only 10 shots! --I kid you not.With this camera, I can take many pictures and not charge it for DAYS and it still lasts! I am also a big fan of the Intelligent Auto feature... It basically does the thinking for me and that's especially handy for someone who's not used to taking pictures! It's super accessible -I can carry it anywhere now- and it looks cute too, no matter what.For the price, I definetely recommend this camera, it will not dissapoint!

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Amy Jo Montgomery "tremonty"
Reviews.Content: I love this little camera.  Easy to work and great for the price.  I am not an expert but this camera makes me feel like one.  I would recommend this to anyone who loves a small camera that is easy to work and does not want to spend a fortune.

Reviews.Title: Compact and easy to use camera, with high resolution.
Reviews.Author: bahrelfi
Reviews.Content: Compact and portable camera. The menu is easy to use, especially with the panasonic intelligent auto, you can basically take picture in every condition, and still get the best picture. I really recommended this camera for those who jut want to take picture and don't want to fuss about camera setting.

Reviews.Title: Pleased...so far
Reviews.Author: LClark
Reviews.Content: I hate to admit I haven't taken the time to learn all there is to know about using the camera since Christmas.  However, I plan to put it to good use in the near months.  Without reading the manual I've been able to take simple pictures of good quality.  Since I'm not a pro, the camera has met my needs to this point.  I bought it because of the reviews in Consumer Reports.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Me
Reviews.Content: I love this camera! It takes fabulous pictures. Sometimes the flash can whiten out certain pics too much, but it's usually any easy fix with a slight adjustment. I was very impressed with the quality of my photosespecially once I downloaded them to my computer! I definitely recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Recommend this product to everybody
Reviews.Author: yta
Reviews.Content: IT MAKES GREAT PICTURES! I bought it before as a gift for my uncle, and I almost left it for myself...but than I just bough a second one. It is doing great pictures for the price you pay.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FH20 is a great point&shoot; camera!
Reviews.Author: M. Uratani "Dog Lover"
Reviews.Content: Love this camera, small enought to fit in pocket.  This camera takes great pictures and has a long 7X zoom for those far away shots.  I chose this model camera because it consistently had high ratings and good reviews from other buyers, and I wanted a small point and shoot that was easy to operate.  Great little camera for a low price.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera!
Reviews.Author: jjl0412
Reviews.Content: After much research and finally subscribing and seeing this camera as one of 13 top picks @ Consumer Review, I chose Amazon because of previous purchases. Price and delivery can't be beat.  I wanted a camera that was rich in quality, ease of use, and excellent results. This was a BD gift for my wife.  We love it.  Very Please.

Reviews.Title: Best Camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Kreyfeld70
Reviews.Content: Comparing similar cameras in this price range this was the best featured camera. I compared it to similar Canon, Sony and Nikon cameras and found it to have the best features for the price. With 8x zoom, 5 exposure burst and High Definition movie capabilities, 14 megapixels it is just what I was looking for. All of the features work as advertised. The picture quality is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: great little camera
Reviews.Author: leslie o'keeffe
Reviews.Content: This camera is quick and takes good pictures in low light situations, which is truly what I wanted it for.  My more expensive camera's take more time in low light situations which makes it difficult at times to capture the picture...not with this camera!

Reviews.Title: Wonderful Camera
Reviews.Author: vyrianna
Reviews.Content: I just received this camera today, and am extremely pleased with it.  I use the IA feature, and it has taken wonderful pictures in the low light situations we have in the house with flash.  Our daughter does not look washed out or muddy (over saturated) in them at all.  They come out clear, with good color quality.  We've also tested the macro mode, and it works wonderfully on my husband's HO train cars, wonderful detail, focused properly etc.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: steve
Reviews.Content: i purchased this camera for my wife for christmas and she loves it.it is very easy to use and she loves the zoom and picture quality.we have only had it for about 2 weeks so time will tell but so far we love this camera

Reviews.Title: Awesome little camera
Reviews.Author: Cheri Armentrout
Reviews.Content: I had researched for 6 month's on all the different camera's.My 1st digital was given to me used and I loved it even though it was a few year's old-It was a Panasonic.  So after all the research I thought go with the Panasonic,The only thing I was leary about was the battery,you have to charge it in the charger they provide.(other camera you used AA batteries & I had rechargeables) After using new camera for over a month and I've taken over a 100 picture's ,I've only had to charge the battery once.It's really easy and a nice little charger. I am very very happy with this purchase.It is easy to use and  quick to download picture's into my MacBook Pro. Haven't had to use customer service so can not rate that. But this camera get's 5 star's from me.. I should of went with my gut and not waited so long to purchase it.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: S. Attaway
Reviews.Content: I have always had a Sony cybershot.  I decided to change camera's due to the memory stick (got tired of keeping up with adapter).  I love this camera.  It's a simple easy to use point and shoot.  I have taken pictures inside and out.  I love how you can just let it pick the setting for you.  I haven't tried the video yet, but I never really cared for that on my cybershot.  I paid less for this camera than I did my sony 2 years ago and love it more.  Threw the sony in my backseat and haven't given it a second thought.

Reviews.Title: Great, affordable camera
Reviews.Author: Sara P.
Reviews.Content: I love this camera.  It's so easy to use that I was taking pictures before even reading the directions.  The picture quality is crisp and clear.  You can't find a better digital camera out there for the money.  Great price!  Great camera!

Reviews.Title: Fantastic camera!
Reviews.Author: Kaitrin
Reviews.Content: Absolutely wonderful camera!  I LOVE LOVE LOVE this camera so much I recomended it to a friend and they are just as happy with it as I am.

Reviews.Title: Great for the money
Reviews.Author: P. beaver "dog lover"
Reviews.Content: Great camera for the money.  Sharp clear photos, great size- and the battery really lasts forever!  Lasted all day at Disney and still had power left! Only reason not getting 5 stars is I would have liked to see a button on outside to record video vs having to go thro menu.

Reviews.Title: Easy & quick
Reviews.Author: Lammy
Reviews.Content: This camera is so easy to figure out. Perfect for quick shots. The battery seems to last longer also. Buying from Amazon is easy too with free shipping  . I got this camera in 2 days. The reviews are a big help.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for the "just want to take pictures" person
Reviews.Author: Daniel T. Carter
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my wife for her birthday.  I also looked at the ZR3 and the ZS5 models.  I settled on this model because it is very simple to operate and the controls were intuitive.  My wife, though smart, doesn't care about shutter speed, iso, f-stops and all that stuff, she just wants to point and shoot the grandkids.  This camera fills the bill perfectly.  And after looking through the advanced manual (on the cd provided), all that fancy stuff is there if you ever want to mess with it.  Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Great value!
Reviews.Author: A Customer
Reviews.Content: I love this camera!  The price is awesome.  Originally, looked at Sony Cybershot, but you get more bang for your buck with this camera.  Love the features.  Pictures are very clear.

Reviews.Title: Great pictures
Reviews.Author: BJ Morgan "MorganSail"
Reviews.Content: This little camera is my fourth or fifth digital and takes the best pictures yet.I love the 14 mega pixels and the 8x zoom. One complaint is that I like cameras with atraditional viewfinder which this camera lacks. The LCD screen works fine in most situations buta viewfinder really helps when sun makes the LCD hard to see.The menu system is not as user friendly as some others but I like the intelligent Auto which seemsto work really well most of the time. The photo software included with the product is uselessbut this is a common problem and good free software is available on line.

Reviews.Title: Great little Camera
Reviews.Author: Laura A. Hoffman
Reviews.Content: Love the size and the 14 megapix.  Great clear images....great zoom....Excellent price.  Can't go wrong with this one...and a rechargeable battery!  Perfect!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: fishyks
Reviews.Content: this camera was well worth its price. easy to use, light, and great pictures. i can only recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Amazing camera
Reviews.Author: Christine Schiefer
Reviews.Content: This is by far the best camera I've purchased... I bought a Kodak EasyShare last year and had so many problems with it.  The best part of this camera is definitely its battery time--it lasts for days and days with repeated use.  Furthermore, it is quick to turn on and easy to control and change.  Takes great quality pictures and is easy to pull out and use at a moment's notice. I love it!

Reviews.Title: LOVE this camera
Reviews.Author: MarlaF
Reviews.Content: This camera is great!! If you are a photography buff, this one is excellent and ez to switch from setting to setting to achieve the correct lighting. It takes some practice to find the right settings, however the AI (auto Intellegence) feature takes over if you just want a quick fool proof photo. I recently went to Europe and am vey pleased with my lovely photos.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Purple Momma
Reviews.Content: Love this camera; had never owned a Panasonic. Takes clear sharp pix's and was delivered sooner than I expected.

Reviews.Title: really like this little camera
Reviews.Author: Floinnc
Reviews.Content: Easy to use. Just enlarged a picture I took ( at a drugstore kiosk) to an 8 x 10 and it is beautiful and sharp. Only problem is common to this type of camera, and that is it is difficult to see the object in sunlight through the viewfinder. Still learning to use all the options.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Bought this online as a used item.  The price was very good.  The free shipping took a while, but the camera works great! No regrets on this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price
Reviews.Author: Debstl78
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a small, easy camera. I really like this one. It takes great pictures and has alot of cool features. If you're looking for a camera at a great price that takes great pics, this is it!

Reviews.Title: Panasonic LUMIX DMC-FH20
Reviews.Author: Donna J Pray
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. the zoom quality is awesome. Many features I'm eager to experiment with. I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: So far so good...
Reviews.Author: Aunt Nae
Reviews.Content: I just received my Lumix DMC-FH20 and I'm so excited!Shipping was 6 calendar days. Tracking was easy, and the entire order was complete.Basic instructions are in a printed manual, detailed camera workings are on an enclosed CD.Battery charged in under 2 hours.Initial indoor trial shots were great.  Even ones that I tried to mess up (low light, too close) worked great.  It was fun to watch an image look shakey on the screen, but capture crystal clear!I was hoping for a faster save time so I could click-click-click.  Even with the class 6 SD card, it took a second before I could take the next.  Literally one second!On playback for a 15 second movie recording, I couln't hear much sound. But until I transfer the file to a computer I won't rate that as a negative.While the settings seem really self explanitory, there were some options I couldn't immediately figure out.  (How to delete multiple images, what some symbols meant.)Once I figure out all the options/settings I'll report back.

Reviews.Title: Think twice about this purchase
Reviews.Author: moe
Reviews.Content: The camera stopped working after 30 days of minimal use. Unable to determine what problem , I was informed by the manufacturer that I would have to return the camera and they would then send me a refurbished one of similar style.  Why would I purchase a brand new camera and then accept a used or maybe a store demo (his words) one in its place.I also purchased and extended warranty with square trade that will be null in void on a refurbished camera.This really wasn't what a grandmother wants when buying a present for her first granddaughter's graduation.

Reviews.Title: great give
Reviews.Author: adrian
Reviews.Content: its a great give, mmy mother in law was very happy with these cam. Its an excelent product

Reviews.Title: maybe it's just me...
Reviews.Author: michellejack
Reviews.Content: but I haven't had very good fortune with this camera. I bought it to replace a Kodak Easyshare that had shutter lag pretty bad and I think this camera is even worse. I have tried various modes and most of the pics have come out blurry, fuzzy, too dark, etc and not to mention all of the good shots were missed because of the lag. Also, I like to date stamp my pictures on occasion and the only way to do that with this camera is to go through your pictures and select each one INDIVIDUALLY that you would like to have stamped. There is no "select all" option which is beyond belief and once it stamps the pic it resizes pretty small. My prev camera that cost half the price of this one handled stamping way better than this one so beware. The only pro is that it is purple and cute. Overall, a huge disappointment!

Reviews.Title: good price for a non pro cam
Reviews.Author: catpriv
Reviews.Content: everything wasexcellent, although the 8x optical zoom is not as good as in other cameras, but is an excellent product for the value

Reviews.Title: Great camera for a great price!
Reviews.Author: shopgirl
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a good camera with more mp than the one I had before and more digital zoom, but still slim and light. This one had a great price and had all of my requirements! And its purple, my favorite color! It got here really fast, well packed and ready to use! Loved it! totally recommend!!!

Reviews.Title: Alta Calidad de imagenes
Reviews.Author: Josue Gonzalez... Desde Costa Rica
Reviews.Content: Tengo esta camara hace muy poco tiempo, pero estoy satisfecho de haber comprado este producto, es de facil uso y de mucha elegancia, ademas presenta una gran variedad de enfoques y tonos de luz, asi como colores, lo que hace que se puedan tomar fotos en casi cualquier situacion. Su precio es muy bueno en relacion a lo que la camara ofrece, creo que vale la pena tenerla.De facil manejo para quienes ya an tenido una camara.Creo que el unico detalle malo es, que se hace dificil pasar de tomar una fotografia a grabar un video.Pero por todo lo demas es un excelente producto.

Reviews.Title: Great Quality
Reviews.Author: Lauren
Reviews.Content: Pros:-Nice size & weight, fits in pocket easily-Great picture quality for a point-and-shoot!-Many settings to choose from-Quick to powerup and shoot right away-Simple & easy to useCons:-Some settings werent the best; the night sky one was agony to try and use-Video takes up a lot of memory space, can't record for long-Do not drop this camera with it on!! I dropped it a few inches from the ground when the lense open and it completely broke the camera.-It seems to get system errors rather easily
